Package controller

Class modifyProductFormController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.modifyProductFormController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class modifyProductFormController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The modifyProductFormController class is used as the Controller for modifyProductFormScreen.fxml.
    Author:
    Mary Williams

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      modifyProductFormController​(Product modifySelectedProduct)
      The modifyProductFormController method is used to create a Product within the Controller to work with as modifications are made.

        Product productToModify

    • Constructor Detail

      • modifyProductFormController

        public modifyProductFormController​(Product modifySelectedProduct)
        The modifyProductFormController method is used to create a Product within the Controller to work with as modifications are made.
        Parameters:
        modifySelectedProduct - The Product selected in mainFormScreen.fxml that is passed when modifyProductFormController is called, used to initialize Text Fields, Table Views, and gather the Product ID.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        The initialize method takes data from the productToModify to initialize values into the Text Fields, and sets the allParts and associatedParts tables to the allParts and associatedParts Observable Lists. It starts the allParts table with all Parts in the system, not filtering them to any search. Table placeholders are set in case there are no Parts in the system, or no Parts associated with the Product.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - Resource pointer used by initialize.
        resourceBundle - Locale-specific objects used by initialize.

      • partSearchTextF

        void partSearchTextF​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        The partSearchTextF method searches the allParts Observable List using Inventory.lookupPart, and sets the allPartsTableView to parts that match the search. Table placeholder is set in case no parts are found that match the search.
        Parameters:
        event - The KeyEvent that triggers this method. Every time the user types or deletes in the modifyProductSearch Text Field this method is called.

      • clearPartSearch

        void clearPartSearch​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        The clearPartSearch method clears the modifyProductSearch Text Field and resets the allPartsTableView list to allParts. Table placeholder is set in case there are no parts in the system.
        Parameters:
        event - The MouseEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks back into the modifyProductSearch Text Field this method is called.

      • modifyProductAssociateButton

        void modifyProductAssociateButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        The modifyProductAssociateButton method associates a Part with the Product, adding it to the associatedParts Observable List and displaying it in the associatedPartsTableView. If there are no parts in the system to select from, or if there is nothing selected, this method instead shows a dialog box with a related error message.
        Parameters:
        event - The ActionEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks on the 'Add' Button this method is called.

      • modifyProductDisassociateButton

        void modifyProductDisassociateButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        The modifyProductDisassociateButton method removes an associated Part from the Product, removing it from the associatedParts Observable List and from the associatedPartsTableView. If there are no associated parts, or if there is nothing selected, this method instead shows a dialog box with a related error message. It confirms that the user would like to remove a Part from being associated with the Product.
        Parameters:
        event - The ActionEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks on the 'Remove Associated Part' Button this method is called.

      • modifyProductSaveButton

        void modifyProductSaveButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        The modifyProductSaveButton method checks that the user input valid data into each Text Field, confirms the user would like to save the modifications, updates the Product, and returns to mainFormScreen.fxml. Data validation checks performed include checking if any fields are empty, that reasonable doubles or integers are input into the correct fields, and logical checks for Price, Inv, Min, and Max. Dialog boxes with relevant error messages show up if the user has input anything incorrectly. A new Product is created, replacing the old Product in the Inventory. A confirmation dialog box appears confirming that the user would like to save the modifications to the Product.
        Parameters:
        event - The ActionEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks on the 'Save' Button this method is called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Failed to load mainFormScreen.fxml.

      • modifyProductCloseButton

        void modifyProductCloseButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        The modifyProductCloseButton method closes the modifyProductFormScreen.fxml and returns the user to mainFormScreen.fxml. This method confirms that the user would like to return without saving or modifying the Product.
        Parameters:
        event - The ActionEvent that triggers this method. When the user clicks on the 'Cancel' Button this method is called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Failed to load mainFormScreen.fxml.
